title: Time and Calendar Concepts

vocab.definition: One time when the sun comes up and goes down

teachingNotes: Use classroom calendar daily. Discuss daily routines and sequence of events. Practice days of the week song.

sample.question: Name the days of the week in order.
expectedAny: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday

sample.question: What do you do in the morning?
How many days are in a week?

truefalse.question: There are 7 days in a week.
Saturday and Sunday are weekend days.
There are 12 months in a year.
Night time is when we usually sleep.
There are 8 days in a week.
expectedAny: there are 7 days in a week

multiplechoice.question: Which takes longer?
expectedAny: a week is 7 days, which is longer than 1 day

multiplechoice.question: How many months are in a year?
When do most people eat lunch?

fillintheblank.question: There are _____ days in a week.
There are _____ months in a year.

shortanswer.question: What do you do in the morning before you come to school?
Name three things you do at night.
What activities do you do on weekends?
What happens during your bedtime routine?
How do you know it's morning?
What makes today different from yesterday?

wordProblems.question: If today is Wednesday and your birthday is in 2 days, what day is your birthday?
School is 5 days a week. If you go to school Monday through Friday, how many days is that?
There are 12 months in a year. If we've had 3 months, how many months are left?
If Saturday is day 6 of the week, what number day is Monday?
Emma goes to dance class every Tuesday. How many times does she go in 3 weeks?
There are 7 days in a week. How many days are in 2 weeks?
If today is the 15th day of the month and there are 30 days in the month, how many days are left?
